nodes.bodyText: This is a public method, so you can't necessarily make this assumption.
The change is moved to the BatchFinderResponseBuilder class now, and it is only limited in that class use case
Is this extra logic necessary? Isn't the parsed mask tree available in the response builder?
yes, you are right,  the mastrees are generated during the class ResourceContextImpl constructor, so to avoid this extra step, I just need a reference from ResourceContextImpl instance
Once again, this method is public so you should be careful about changing behavior.
yes, it is resolved

Agree with Evan, also the projection parameters are already available as MaskTree in resourContext. So a better fix would be to update the buildCriteriaURI() method in BatchFinderResponseBuilder to replace the projection params with masktree objects.
Yes, changed the way I extract projection MaskTree by directly referencing those projection fields which already in ResourceContextImpl
You should create a copy instead of modifying the underlying parameters. There might be logic elsewhere (and custom filter) that depend on these parameters parsed from URI.
Got it, DataMap has two copy related method, clone and copy, the clone seems to be a shallow copy and the copy seems to be suit for this use case
Deep copy might be expensive and for this usecase, a shallow copy is sufficient.
This is not a good way to recover this error. I'd prefer failing the request as this is unexpected.
Instead of copy I used clone, according to the comment and short code trace, clone should be the shallow copy

These tested URL has not:

Be real batch criterias at all (just single criteria) I will add to later test
These URLs are not exhaustive, I will add more URL test cases

In this part of error handling, because I don't expect to change all the callers of buildCriteriaURI with throws
so I instead throws a RuntimeException
I think throwing a RestLiServiceException with 500 status code and cleaner error message would be good here. For reference you can check the other response builders.
I just fixed it, one point I am curious is that, for each entry in the batch, is it better to put in 500 error code for each entry, or just fail the whole batch in one 500 code?
For this, just one 500 error is fine. The paging parameters are common for all criteria.
got it I will make another change then, right now i put failure in one entry, the other will continue to process or they will generate another 500.
@karthikbalasub , all the changes regarding clone and exception handling are reverted since I use a simpler way to address the original issue
Why is this an array instead of a constant? Will we have more values here?
Yeah, it is an array because I found we have two protocol versions in the code. So I assume it is needed to test in both protocol versions.

The detail is, if there exists some http client and it send a request with a http header saying it is protocol version 100, then our ResourceContextImpl class internally will parse query parameters differently.
I understand that we need to support both 1.0 and 2.0, however all your array values are 2.0
yes, I met some issues where it only happens in 1.0 so I will include that fix in this PR and then that is complete
As we discussed, let us get the fix in for the projection issue with protocol 2.0.0 support and raise a separate PR for 1.0.0 issue.
yes, the 1.0.0 part of the issue is long existing one

Note the original case's %3B became ;
that is minor but I just want to highlight it in case something is wrong

nodes.bodyText: If I remember correctly, you do not have to do this. You can just throw a RestLiServiceException with 500 status from within extractQueryParamsFromResourceContext method and the framework should convert that into an error response.
Sounds good
I addressed the original issue with another simpler approach, so returning 500 as server side error is not needed now
I'd suggest making private methods package-private if they need to be accessed by a unit test. Making it protected opens the access too much and implies an intended inheritance relationship.
Done
nit: fix spacing

Wrapping so much logic here in a try-catch is excessive and makes it harder to understand.
Given that the resulting service error says that the error happens because Rest.li was unable to build the criteria URI, it makes sense to me to actually put this try-catch and service error inside #buildCriteriaURI

nodes.bodyText: As we discussed earlier, this logic is not needed since we addressed the problem in the other way

nodes.bodyText:
Using try-catches to dictate normal logic flow (rather than just for exceptions) is bad practice. I would suggest retrieving the generic object from the map and checking its type.
Overall though this is better IMO.
Thanks for the advice, fixed it.

Minor comments:

Add a final else case which throws an exception. If one of these projection params is present but is not a string or data map, then it should be treated as an illegal argument.
A minor optimization could be made here. You have 4 different get accessor calls here, you could do one initial get then perform the checks/casting on that object.
Fixed
This is a cleaner solution, Nice!
remove CloneNotSupportedException
Done
Is this for testing purpose only? If yes, we should add a comment "package-private for testing purpose".
Sorry just saw this, will do in my next PR.
This is for testing only right now
